page.title: 10Food Anna Tatton Age 11
page.content: In the seventies there were 50,000 vegetarians, now there are 1.5 million, probrably about 95% of vegetarians are put off by the cruelty to animals and 5% by health considerations. Recipes ar getting more international; People a century ago would never have thought of cooking lasagne or spaghetti. Junk Food (e.g. chips) is more popular. Sunday lunches are going out partly because of vegetarianism and partly because of the time and effort involved. Sausage Surprise Chop six potatoes, boil for twenty minutes. Get six sausages, put on top potatoes. Sauce- Beat together two eggs (pinch of everything). Add grated chees marg, flour, chopped mint, vinegar, salt, pepper, oats, another egg. Beat together. Pour the egg mix onto sausage and potatoes. Put in oven; 400 degrees for about forty minutes.
